security_audit.summary: Pure prompt/documentation skill with no executable code, no file access, no network operations, and no sensitive capabilities. Contains only Tailwind CSS guidance and best practices.

content.user_title: Style UI components with Tailwind CSS
content.value_statement: Building responsive, accessible user interfaces requires deep knowledge of utility classes and design patterns. This skill provides expert guidance for mobile-first layouts, dark mode support, and component styling using Tailwind CSS conventions.
actual_capabilities: Create mobile-first responsive layouts with breakpoint prefixes
Configure custom themes and color schemes in tailwind.config.ts
Style React components with utility-first approach
Implement dark mode support using dark: variants
Apply accessibility best practices including focus states and color contrast
Build responsive grid layouts and dashboard components
limitations: Does not modify project files directly - provides guidance only
Cannot install or configure Tailwind CSS in your project
No runtime code execution or build process execution
Limited to Tailwind CSS v3+ patterns and conventions

use_cases.title: Component Styling
use_cases.description: Style React components with utility classes for buttons, forms, cards, and layouts

use_cases.title: Responsive Layouts
use_cases.description: Build mobile-first responsive dashboards and grids that adapt across breakpoints

use_cases.title: Dark Mode Support
use_cases.description: Implement theme switching with dark mode variants and color scheme configuration

prompt_templates.title: Style a button
prompt_templates.prompt: Style a button component with primary and secondary variants using Tailwind CSS. Include hover states, focus rings, and support for small and medium sizes.

prompt_templates.title: Build responsive grid
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a responsive grid layout that shows 1 column on mobile, 2 on tablet, 3 on desktop, and 4 on large screens using Tailwind CSS breakpoints.

prompt_templates.title: Add dark mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Add dark mode support to an existing card component. Include proper color contrast ratios for both light and dark themes.

prompt_templates.title: Custom theme config
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure a custom Tailwind theme with semantic color names (primary, secondary, accent) and custom spacing scale in tailwind.config.ts.

output_examples.input: Style a KPI card component with mobile-first responsive design and dark mode support
output: Create base styles for mobile viewport (375px)
Add sm:, md:, lg: breakpoints for larger screens
Include dark: color variants for dark mode

best_practices: Start with mobile styles, then enhance with breakpoints for larger screens
Use semantic color names (primary, secondary) instead of hardcoded values
Always include focus-visible or focus:ring for interactive elements
anti_patterns: Overriding entire theme instead of extending it in tailwind.config.ts
Using custom CSS when utility classes would suffice
Skipping focus states on interactive elements
Hardcoding color values instead of using theme variables

faq.question: What Tailwind CSS versions are supported?
faq.answer: Tailwind CSS v3 and v4 with JIT mode enabled by default.

faq.question: What breakpoints are available by default?
faq.answer: Default breakpoints: sm (640px), md (768px), lg (1024px), xl (1280px), 2xl (1536px).

faq.question: How do I integrate with shadcn/ui components?
faq.answer: Follow shadcn design tokens and patterns. Use CVA for component variants and class-variance-authority.

faq.question: Does this skill access my project files?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides guidance only and does not read, write, or modify any project files.

faq.question: Why is my responsive layout not working?
faq.answer: Ensure correct breakpoint order (mobile first) and that you are testing at actual viewport widths, not component widths.

faq.question: How is this different from using plain CSS?
faq.answer: Tailwind uses utility classes for faster prototyping, better consistency, and automatic purging of unused styles in production.
